main_definition: A vacuum refers to an area devoid of matter, specifically air or other gases; a cleaning device used to remove dirt from floors and surfaces by suction; and a metaphorical expression implying emptiness or lack of substance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A physical space devoid of matter, particularly air
meanings_and_examples.example: The vacuum created inside the sealed container was used to study the behavior of gases.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A machine designed for cleaning floors and surfaces by suction
meanings_and_examples.example: She spent an hour using her vacuum cleaner to tidy up her living room.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression implying emptiness or lack of substance
meanings_and_examples.example: When he talked about the new policy, it was just empty rhetouds; a real vacuum.
